timetrails.about.footer.note: Note: This page is an introduction to the product description and concept, and the features and copy may be adjusted with version updates.
timetrails.about.lead: TimeTrails aims to help you turn information like "where you've been, how long you've stayed, and how far you've traveled" into a personal timeline that is viewable, organized, and exportable. Our core philosophy is: user controllocal firstminimize collection.
timetrails.about.meta.description: Learn about TimeTrails: what we do, why we do it, and our data and privacy philosophy.
timetrails.about.meta.title: About TimeTrails
timetrails.about.og.description: Learn about TimeTrails: what we do, why we do it, and our data and privacy philosophy.
timetrails.about.og.title: About TimeTrails
timetrails.about.panel.contact.dev: Development entity: 上海树下小屋网络科技有限公司
timetrails.about.panel.contact.p: If you have any questions, suggestions, or privacy-related requests, please contact us via email: house@sxxw.site
timetrails.about.panel.contact.title: Contact Us
timetrails.about.panel.permissions.li0: Location: is used for tracking and waypoints.
timetrails.about.panel.permissions.li1: Sports and Fitness: for more accurate motion recognition.
timetrails.about.panel.permissions.li2: photo: is used only when you import/link photos.
timetrails.about.panel.permissions.li3: Notification: is used to remind and synchronize status prompts (optional).
timetrails.about.panel.permissions.title: Possible Permissions Requested
timetrails.about.panel.privacy.li0: Local First: By default, data is stored on your device.
timetrails.about.panel.privacy.li1: Sync optional: will only use iCloud or self-built services for syncing when you actively enable it.
timetrails.about.panel.privacy.li2: permissions can be revoked: You can revoke location, motion, photo, and other permissions at any time in the system settings.
timetrails.about.panel.privacy.li3: does not sell data: We do not sell your personal data to third parties.
timetrails.about.panel.privacy.note: For detailed terms, please refer to Privacy Policy.
timetrails.about.panel.privacy.title: Privacy and Data Principles
timetrails.about.panel.what.li0: Automatic/semi-automatic recording of routes, waypoints, and mileage statistics
timetrails.about.panel.what.li1: Organize daily travel into a timeline and map visualization
timetrails.about.panel.what.li2: Supports export (e.g., GPX/CSV, if you enable it or if your version supports it)
timetrails.about.panel.what.title: What We Do
timetrails.about.panel.why.p: Most "life recording" products are either overly cloud-based or overly social. TimeTrails is more like your personal sailing log: recording is for reflection, organization, and understanding oneself, not for being fed by algorithms.
timetrails.about.panel.why.title: Why We Do It
timetrails.about.subtitle: A more 'locally focused' tool for tracking and recording memories

timetrails.index.feature.0.p: Record the movement process into tracks and statistics with minimal disturbance; permissions can be revoked at any time.
timetrails.index.feature.0.title: Automatic Recording
timetrails.index.feature.1.p: Timeline + Map Dual Perspective: Review by day, aggregate by location, recap by mileage.
timetrails.index.feature.1.title: Visual Organization
timetrails.index.feature.2.p: Only a small number of necessary open-source components are integrated, with default local storage and processing; no third-party data analysis/ad SDK is integrated. You can clear, export, or revoke permissions at any time.
timetrails.index.feature.2.title: Privacy First
timetrails.index.features.p: No complex features piled up, just making the 'track recording' process smooth, clear, and controllable.
timetrails.index.features.title: Core Competencies
timetrails.index.footer: © TimeTrails · 上海树下小屋网络科技有限公司.
timetrails.index.hero.p: The value of recording daily trails is not about "having many points", but rather being able to review, organize, and analyze . TimeTrails turns your movements into a clear timeline : where you went today, how long you stayed, how far you walked, all easily understood at a glance. At the same time, we insist on local priority and minimizing collection —you record to understand yourself, not to be understood by the platform.
timetrails.index.hero.title: TimeTrails
timetrails.index.hero.trust: Local saving and processing by default; whether to enable synchronization, whether to export, and to whom to export - all controlled by you.
timetrails.index.links.p: Want to learn more? Here are the product philosophy, privacy statement, and your feedback entry.
timetrails.index.links.title: Related Pages
timetrails.index.meta.description: Turn your phone's "where you've been, how long you've stayed, how far you've walked" into a personal timeline that you can revisit.
timetrails.index.meta.title: TimeTrails
timetrails.index.og.description: Turn your travels into a timeline that can be revisited: tracks, stop points, mileage statistics, local first.
timetrails.index.og.title: TimeTrails
timetrails.index.quick.li0: Automatically generate 'Today's Trail' every day: route, mileage, and stop points at a glance.
timetrails.index.quick.li1: Review a trip: Browse your action timeline by day/location
timetrails.index.quick.li2: Personal review: long-term changes in commuting, exercise, and travel patterns
timetrails.index.quick.li3: Recall a certain day: quickly locate "that store", "that road", "that walk" on the timeline.
timetrails.index.quick.li4: Track your pace: trends in commuting/exercise/travel mileage, long-term comparisons are more intuitive.
timetrails.index.quick.title: What will you use it for
timetrails.index.subtitle: Turn your phone's "where you've been, how long you've stayed, how far you've walked" into a personal timeline that you can revisit.

timetrails.privacy.intro: Welcome to TimeTrails . We value your privacy and data security. This policy aims to clearly and readably explain how we handle your information under the principles of default minimal collection , local-first processing , and user control .
timetrails.privacy.lastUpdated.label: Last updated:
timetrails.privacy.meta.description: TimeTrails privacy policy and data description.
timetrails.privacy.meta.title: TimeTrails Privacy Policy
timetrails.privacy.og.description: How we collect, use, and protect your data.
timetrails.privacy.og.title: TimeTrails Privacy Policy
timetrails.privacy.section.changes.p: We may update this policy to reflect changes in features or regulations. Significant changes will be prompted in the app or on this page, and the 'Last Updated' date will be updated.
timetrails.privacy.section.changes.title: Changes
timetrails.privacy.section.collect.items: Location information (optional): used to record your travel routes, stop points, and map visualization. Permissions: NSLocationWhenInUseUsageDescription, NSLocationAlwaysAndWhenInUseUsageDescription.
Sports and Fitness (Optional): Used for more accurate determination of movement status and mileage statistics. Permission: NSMotionUsageDescription.
Photo Access (Optional): Used when you choose to import or associate photos. Permissions: NSPhotoLibraryAddUsageDescription, NSPhotoLibraryUsageDescription.
Notifications (Optional) : Used for interactive reminders (e.g., completion records, sync status).
Crash and Diagnostic Data (Optional): If you agree to share diagnostic information through system settings or TestFlight, we may receive anonymous crash logs to improve stability.
timetrails.privacy.section.collect.title: What information do we collect
timetrails.privacy.section.contact.dev: 上海树下小屋网络科技有限公司
timetrails.privacy.section.contact.label: Developer
Email
timetrails.privacy.section.contact.title: Contact Us
timetrails.privacy.section.kids.p: This application is intended for the general public and is not designed for children. If you believe we have collected information from children without parental consent, please contact us for resolution.
timetrails.privacy.section.kids.title: Children's Privacy
Access and Export : View and export your data (such as GPX/CSV, if provided) within the app.
Correction and Deletion : Edit or delete your records, tracks, and media associations.
Permission Control : You can withdraw location, motion, photo, and other permissions at any time in iOS settings.
Different regional regulations: We respect applicable laws (such as GDPR/CCPA). To exercise your rights, please contact the email below.
timetrails.privacy.section.rights.title: Your Rights
timetrails.privacy.section.storage.items: Local First: Trajectory data is stored locally on your device by default.
Sync optional: If you enable iCloud Sync or self-built server, data will be encrypted and transmitted to the respective service according to your choice for multi-device use.
retention period : You can delete data within the app; we do not retain a separate copy of your personal data outside the app.
timetrails.privacy.section.storage.title: Data Storage and Retention
timetrails.privacy.section.third.p: The app may use services provided by Apple (such as iCloud, system location, etc.). These services are governed by their respective terms and privacy policies. We do not sell your personal data to third parties.
timetrails.privacy.section.third.title: Third Party Services
timetrails.privacy.section.use.items.0: Generate and present tracks, statistics, and map visualizations locally on the device.
timetrails.privacy.section.use.items.1: (Optional) Used to keep data consistent between your devices when you enable iCloud/private server synchronization.
timetrails.privacy.section.use.items.2: Improve application performance, stability, and user experience (e.g., fixes based on anonymous crash logs).
timetrails.privacy.section.use.title: How We Use Information
timetrails.guide.hero.subtitle: User Version
timetrails.guide.hero.title: Data Import User Guide
timetrails.guide.lead.p1: You can import data files from your computer into TimeTrails via the local area network.
timetrails.guide.meta.title: Data Import User Guide
timetrails.guide.section1.row1: Connect your phone and computer to the same Wi-Fi
timetrails.guide.section1.row2.note: Supports database file .db and track file .gpx
timetrails.guide.section1.row2.title: Prepare the file to be imported
timetrails.guide.section1.title: 1. Preparation Work
timetrails.guide.section2.step2: Enter the 'Data Import / Data Transfer' page
timetrails.guide.section2.step4.text: After success, a URL (local network address) will be displayed on the page.
timetrails.guide.section2.title: 2. Enable Import Service on Mobile
timetrails.guide.section3.step1: In your computer's browser, enter the URL displayed on your phone.
timetrails.guide.section3.step2: Open it, then select and upload your file.
timetrails.guide.section3.step3: After the upload is complete, the file will automatically appear in the file list on your phone.
timetrails.guide.section3.title: 3. Uploading Files on the Computer
timetrails.guide.section4.alert: Please keep the App in the foreground during the import process, and you will see a success message once completed.
timetrails.guide.section4.db.step3: A success message will be displayed upon completion.
timetrails.guide.section4.db.subtitle: Used to restore or migrate entire TimeTrails data
timetrails.guide.section4.gpx.step2: The system will automatically parse and import the track.
timetrails.guide.section4.gpx.subtitle: Displayed on the map by date after the import is complete.
timetrails.guide.section4.lead: In the file list on your phone:
timetrails.guide.section4.title: 4. Import Data
timetrails.guide.section5.tip1.text: Please ensure that you are connected to Wi-Fi, not cellular network.
timetrails.guide.section5.tip1.title: Unable to start the service
timetrails.guide.section5.tip2.text: Some track points are missing time information, and the system will automatically ignore them.
timetrails.guide.section5.tip2.title: Import failed or some data was skipped
timetrails.guide.section5.tip3.text: Refresh the dropdown list to rescan.
timetrails.guide.section5.tip3.title: File not found
timetrails.guide.section5.title: 5. Common Tips and Explanations
timetrails.guide.section6.s1: Before importing, it is recommended to back up the current data.
timetrails.guide.section6.s2Text: Files are typically used for complete migration.
timetrails.guide.section6.s3Text: More suitable for importing single or multiple track records
timetrails.guide.section6.title: 6. Some Suggestions
